verse_en: (The idolaters will be told): "Your gods have refuted your assertion. You can neither avert (your doom) nor receive any help. We shall make the wicked among you taste of severe punishment."
verse_ar: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوكُم بِمَا تَقُولُونَ فَمَا تَسْتَطِيعُونَ صَرْفًۭا وَلَا نَصْرًۭا ۚ وَمَن يَظْلِم مِّنكُمْ نُذِقْهُ عَذَابًۭا كَبِيرًۭا

verse_en: We never sent before you apostles who did not eat food and walk the market places. We make some of you the means of trying the others. So will you persevere? Your Lord is always watching.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْكُلُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشُونَ فِى ٱلْأَسْوَاقِ ۗ وَجَعَلْنَا بَعْضَكُمْ لِبَعْضٍۢ فِتْنَةً أَتَصْبِرُونَ ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ بَصِيرًۭا

verse_en: Those who do not hope to meet Us say: "Why are no angels sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?" They are full of self-conceit and behave with intense arrogance.
verse_ar: ۞ وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَآءَنَا لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْ عُتُوًّۭا كَبِيرًۭا

verse_en: The day they see the angels there will be no happy tidings for the sinners; and they will say: "There is an insurmountable barrier!"
verse_ar: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًۭا مَّحْجُورًۭا

verse_en: We shall turn to their deeds and scatter them like particles of dust.
verse_ar: وَقَدِمْنَآ إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ مِنْ عَمَلٍۢ فَجَعَلْنَٰهُ هَبَآءًۭ مَّنثُورًا

verse_en: The inmates of Paradise will have a better abode that day, and a better resting place.
verse_ar: أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌۭ مُّسْتَقَرًّۭا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًۭا

verse_en: The day the heavens splits asunder with a dazzling white cloud gathering and the angels descend in a continuous stream,
verse_ar: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِٱلْغَمَٰمِ وَنُزِّلَ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ تَنزِيلًا

verse_en: The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels!
verse_ar: ٱلْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ عَسِيرًۭا

verse_en: The sinner will then bite his hand and say: "Would that I had taken the road with the Prophet.
verse_ar: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ ٱلظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَٰلَيْتَنِى ٱتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ ٱلرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًۭا

verse_en: Woe alas, ah would I had not taken so-and-so as friend!
verse_ar: يَٰوَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِى لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًۭا

verse_en: He led me astray from the Warning after it had come to me. Satan always betrays man.
verse_ar: لَّقَدْ أَضَلَّنِى عَنِ ٱلذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَآءَنِى ۗ وَكَانَ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ لِلْإِنسَٰنِ خَذُولًۭا

verse_en: The prophet will say: "O my Lord, my people had fettered the Qur'an."
verse_ar: وَقَالَ ٱلرَّسُولُ يَٰرَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِى ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ هَٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مَهْجُورًۭا

verse_en: Thus do We keep opponents among the sinners for every apostle; yet your Lord is sufficient as a guide and helper.
verse_ar: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِىٍّ عَدُوًّۭا مِّنَ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًۭا وَنَصِيرًۭا

verse_en: The unbelievers say: "Why was the whole Qur'an not sent down all at once to him?" It was sent thus that We may keep your heart resolute. So We enunciated it by steps and distinctly.
verse_ar: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ جُمْلَةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِۦ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَٰهُ تَرْتِيلًۭا

verse_en: There is not an example they advance to which We do not give you a right answer and a better explanation.
verse_ar: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًا

verse_en: Those who will be pushed faces forward into Hell will be in a worse position, farther away from the path.
verse_ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ شَرٌّۭ مَّكَانًۭا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًۭا

verse_en: We gave Moses the Book, and made his brother Aaron his minister,
verse_ar: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَٰبَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُۥٓ أَخَاهُ هَٰرُونَ وَزِيرًۭا

verse_en: Then We told them: "Go to the people who have rejected Our signs." Then We annihilated them completely.
verse_ar: فَقُلْنَا ٱذْهَبَآ إِلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَٰهُمْ تَدْمِيرًۭا

verse_en: We had drowned the people of Noah when they had accused the apostles of lies, and turned them into an example for men. We have prepared a painful punishment for the wicked.
verse_ar: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍۢ لَّمَّا كَذَّبُوا۟ ٱلرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَٰهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَٰهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ ءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۭا

verse_en: (As for) 'Ad, Thamud and the people of ar-Rass, and many generations in between them,
verse_ar: وَعَادًۭا وَثَمُودَا۟ وَأَصْحَٰبَ ٱلرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًۢا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًۭا

verse_en: We administered warnings to each of them, and then destroyed them completely.
verse_ar: وَكُلًّۭا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ ٱلْأَمْثَٰلَ ۖ وَكُلًّۭا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًۭا

verse_en: They must have surely passed by the town on which We had rained the terrible rain of ruin. How could they not have seen it? Still they do not dread the Resurrection.
verse_ar: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَى ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا۟ يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًۭا

verse_en: When they see you they take you only in jest: "Is this the one whom God has sent as messenger?
verse_ar: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا ٱلَّذِى بَعَثَ ٱللَّهُ رَسُولًا

verse_en: He would have surely turned us away from our gods if we had not adhered to them." They will know soon who is farther away from the path when they see the punishment!
verse_ar: إِن كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لَوْلَآ أَن صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا

verse_en: Have you considered him who takes his own lust for his god? Can you stand a surety for him?
verse_ar: أَرَءَيْتَ مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُۥ هَوَىٰهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا

verse_en: Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are no better than cattle; in fact they are farther astray from the path.
verse_ar: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَٱلْأَنْعَٰمِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا

verse_en: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? He could have kept it motionless if He liked. Yet We make the sun its pilot to show the way.
verse_ar: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ ٱلظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَجَعَلَهُۥ سَاكِنًۭا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا ٱلشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًۭا

verse_en: Then We draw it back to Us, withdrawing it little by little.
verse_ar: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَٰهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًۭا يَسِيرًۭا

verse_en: It is He who made the night a covering for you; and made sleep for rest, the day for rising.
verse_ar: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًۭا وَٱلنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًۭا وَجَعَلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ نُشُورًۭا

verse_en: It is He who sends the winds with auspicious news in advance of His benevolence; and We send pure water down from the sky
verse_ar: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ ٱلرِّيَٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ طَهُورًۭا

verse_en: To quicken a region that was dead, and to give it as drink to animals We have created and to men in plenty.
verse_ar: لِّنُحْۦِىَ بِهِۦ بَلْدَةًۭ مَّيْتًۭا وَنُسْقِيَهُۥ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَآ أَنْعَٰمًۭا وَأَنَاسِىَّ كَثِيرًۭا

verse_en: And We distribute it among them in various ways that they may ponder and reflect; yet most men disdain everything but denial and thanklessness.
verse_ar: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَٰهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا۟ فَأَبَىٰٓ أَكْثَرُ ٱلنَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًۭا

verse_en: Had We pleased We could have raised a warner in every town.
verse_ar: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِى كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍۢ نَّذِيرًۭا

verse_en: So do not listen to unbelievers, and strive against them with greater effort.
verse_ar: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ وَجَٰهِدْهُم بِهِۦ جِهَادًۭا كَبِيرًۭا

verse_en: It is He who made two bodies of water flow side by side, one fresh (and) sweet, the other brine (and) bitter, and has placed an interstice, a barrier between them.
verse_ar: ۞ وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى مَرَجَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ هَٰذَا عَذْبٌۭ فُرَاتٌۭ وَهَٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌۭ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًۭا وَحِجْرًۭا مَّحْجُورًۭا

verse_en: It is He who created man from water, then gave him consanguinity and affinity. Your Lord is omnipotent.
verse_ar: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ بَشَرًۭا فَجَعَلَهُۥ نَسَبًۭا وَصِهْرًۭا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًۭا

verse_en: And yet they worship besides God what cannot bring them gain or do them harm. The unbeliever has always been an auxiliary against his Lord.
verse_ar: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱلْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ ظَهِيرًۭا

verse_en: Yet We have not sent you but to give good tidings and to warn.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَٰكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًۭا وَنَذِيرًۭا

verse_en: Tell them: "I do not ask any recompense of you for this other than (urging) whoever likes may take the way to his Lord."
verse_ar: قُلْ مَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًۭا

verse_en: Have trust in God the Living, who will never die, and sing His hallelujas; for He is well aware of the sins of His creatures.
verse_ar: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْحَىِّ ٱلَّذِى لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِۦ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِۦ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِۦ خَبِيرًا

verse_en: He created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them in six spans then assumed His authority. He is the benevolent: Ask those who are well-informed.
verse_ar: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍۢ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۚ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ فَسْـَٔلْ بِهِۦ خَبِيرًۭا

verse_en: When you say to them: "Bow before Ar-Rahman," they say: "What is Ar-Rahman? Should we adore whoever you ask us to?" And their aversion increases further.
verse_ar: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ قَالُوا۟ وَمَا ٱلرَّحْمَٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًۭا ۩

verse_en: Blessed is He who placed in the heavens constellations of stars, and placed a burning lamp in it and the luminous moon.
verse_ar: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجًۭا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَٰجًۭا وَقَمَرًۭا مُّنِيرًۭا

verse_en: It is He who made the night and day an alternation for him who cares to reflect and be grateful.
verse_ar: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةًۭ لِّمَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًۭا

verse_en: Devotees of Ar-Rahman are those who walk with humility on the earth, and when they are addressed by the ignorant, say: 'Peace;"
verse_ar: وَعِبَادُ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ هَوْنًۭا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ ٱلْجَٰهِلُونَ قَالُوا۟ سَلَٰمًۭا

verse_en: And those who spend their nights bowed and standing before their Lord;
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًۭا وَقِيَٰمًۭا

verse_en: Who say: "O our Lord, avert from us the torment of Hell: Its punishment is surely continuous.
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا ٱصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا

verse_en: It is indeed an evil halt and an evil abode;"
verse_ar: إِنَّهَا سَآءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّۭا وَمُقَامًۭا

verse_en: Who are neither prodigal nor miserly in their spending but follow a middle path;
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا۟ وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا۟ وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًۭا

verse_en: Who do not invoke any god apart from God, who do not take a life which God has forbidden except for a cause that is just, and do not fornicate -- and any one who does so will be punished for the crime,
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّفْسَ ٱلَّتِى حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًۭا

verse_en: Whose punishment will be doubled on the Day of Judgement, and he will live for ever in disgrace,
verse_ar: يُضَٰعَفْ لَهُ ٱلْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَٰمَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِۦ مُهَانًا

verse_en: Except those who repent and come to believe and do the right, for whom God will turn evil into goodness, for God is forgiving and kind.
verse_ar: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًۭا صَٰلِحًۭا فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ ٱللَّهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ حَسَنَٰتٍۢ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا

verse_en: Whosoever repents and does the right, will have turned back to God by way of repentance;
verse_ar: وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحًۭا فَإِنَّهُۥ يَتُوبُ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ مَتَابًۭا

verse_en: And those who do not give false evidence, and if they come across unbecoming talk ignore it and pass by in a sedate way;
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ ٱلزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِٱللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا۟ كِرَامًۭا

verse_en: Who, when reminded of their Lord's revelations, do not fall for them like the deaf and blind;
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا۟ عَلَيْهَا صُمًّۭا وَعُمْيَانًۭا

verse_en: And those who say: "O Lord, give us comfort in our spouses and children, and make us paragons of those who follow the straight path."
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّٰتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍۢ وَٱجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا

verse_en: They will be rewarded for their perseverance with lofty mansions in empyrean where they will be received with greetings of peace and salutations,
verse_ar: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ ٱلْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةًۭ وَسَلَٰمًا

verse_en: And abide there for ever: What an excellent destination and abode!
verse_ar: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّۭا وَمُقَامًۭا

verse_en: Say: "My Lord is not concerned on your account if you do not pray to Him. You have surely done with denying; soon will come the inevitable judgement.
verse_ar: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَؤُا۟ بِكُمْ رَبِّى لَوْلَا دُعَآؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًۢا

verse_en: TA SIN MIM.
verse_ar: طسٓمٓ

verse_en: These are the verses of the perspicuous Book.
verse_ar: تِلْكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ

verse_en: You may perhaps wear out your heart because they do not come to belief.
verse_ar: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٌۭ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: We could send down from the heavens a sign to them if We pleased, before which their heads would remain bowed.
verse_ar: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةًۭ فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ

verse_en: Never does a new reminder come to them from Ar-Rahman but they turn away from it.
verse_ar: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ

verse_en: Surely they have done with denying; soon will come to them the news of what they were laughing at.
verse_ar: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ

verse_en: Do they not see the earth, how We grow all kinds of noble things upon it?
verse_ar: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۢ كَرِيمٍ

verse_en: Verily there are signs in this; yet many of them do not believe.
verse_ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Your Lord is surely mighty and merciful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people,
verse_ar: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

verse_en: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"
verse_ar: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ

verse_en: : He said: "O Lord, I fear that they will deny me.
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ

verse_en: My heart is constrained, my tongue falters, so delegate Aaron;
verse_ar: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ

verse_en: And they have a charge (of murder) against me. So I fear that they will kill me."
verse_ar: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌۭ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ

verse_en: (It was) said: "By no means. Go with My signs, both of you. I am verily with you and I hear.
verse_ar: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ

verse_en: Go to the Pharaoh and tell him: 'We bring a message from the Lord of all the worlds
verse_ar: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: That you should send the children of Israel with us.'
verse_ar: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ

verse_en: (The Pharaoh) said: "Did we not bring you up as a child? And you lived a number of years of your life with us.
verse_ar: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًۭا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ

verse_en: And you commited what you did, and you are ungrateful!"
verse_ar: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ

verse_en: (Moses) replied: "I did do that and I was in the wrong,
verse_ar: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًۭا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

verse_en: So I ran away from you out of fear. But my Lord has given me wisdom, and made me an apostle.
verse_ar: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًۭا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ

verse_en: But the favour you oblige me with is that you have enslaved the children of Israel."
verse_ar: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌۭ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ

verse_en: The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"
verse_ar: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you can believe."
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ

verse_en: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"
verse_ar: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُۥٓ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ

verse_en: (Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ

verse_en: (The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you, is certainly mad."
verse_ar: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌۭ

verse_en: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them, if you have sense."
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ

verse_en: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."
verse_ar: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ

verse_en: (Moses) said: "Even though I have brought to you something convincing?"
verse_ar: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَىْءٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ

verse_en: (The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it, if you speak the truth."
verse_ar: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

verse_en: So (Moses) cast his staff, and lo, it turned into a living serpent.
verse_ar: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ

verse_en: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it looked white to the beholders.
verse_ar: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ

verse_en: The Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: "He is certainly a clever magician.
verse_ar: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌۭ

verse_en: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. So, what do you bid?"
verse_ar: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ

verse_en: They said: "Put him and his brother off awhile, and send summoners to the cities to gather
verse_ar: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ

verse_en: And bring the ablest magicians to you."
verse_ar: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍۢ

verse_en: So the magicians were assembled at a stated time and place on an appointed day.
verse_ar: فَجُمِعَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَٰتِ يَوْمٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ

verse_en: And the people were also asked to assemble.
verse_ar: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّجْتَمِعُونَ

verse_en: (They said): "We may haply follow the magicians if they are victorious."
verse_ar: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ

verse_en: When the magicians arrived, they said to the Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we are victorious?" --
verse_ar: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَٰلِبِينَ

verse_en: "Yes," he replied. "You 'will be among the honoured."
verse_ar: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًۭا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ

verse_en: Moses said to them: "Cast what you have to cast."
verse_ar: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ

verse_en: So they cast their ropes and rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall be victorious."
verse_ar: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَٰلِبُونَ

verse_en: Then Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it swallowed up their conjurations.
verse_ar: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ

verse_en: Then the magicians fell prostrating in adoration,
verse_ar: فَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سَٰجِدِينَ

verse_en: And said: "We (affirm and) believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
verse_ar: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
verse_ar: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ

verse_en: Said (the Pharaoh): "You have come to believe in him before I gave you leave. He is surely your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon come to know: I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides, and have every one of you crucified."
verse_ar: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَٰفٍۢ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

verse_en: They said: "There will be no harm. We shall return to our Lord.
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ

verse_en: We certainly hope our Lord will forgive our sins as we are the first to believe."
verse_ar: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: We said to Moses: "Travel by night with My creatures. You will surely be pursued."
verse_ar: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِىٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ

verse_en: Then the Pharaoh sent announcers to the cities,
verse_ar: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ

verse_en: (Proclaiming): "Surely they are a small band (of fugitives).
verse_ar: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌۭ قَلِيلُونَ

verse_en: They are always harassing us.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَآئِظُونَ

verse_en: But we are a fully accounted army."
verse_ar: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَٰذِرُونَ

verse_en: So We made them leave the gardens and springs of water,
verse_ar: فَأَخْرَجْنَٰهُم مِّن جَنَّٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍۢ

verse_en: And treasures and agreeable mansions.
verse_ar: وَكُنُوزٍۢ وَمَقَامٍۢ كَرِيمٍۢ

verse_en: Thus it was; and We made the children of Israel possess them.
verse_ar: كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَٰهَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ

verse_en: But they pursued them at sunrise.
verse_ar: فَأَتْبَعُوهُم مُّشْرِقِينَ

verse_en: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."
verse_ar: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ

verse_en: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."
verse_ar: قَالَ كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ

verse_en: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain.
verse_ar: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ ۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍۢ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ

verse_en: Then We brought the others to that place.
verse_ar: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ

verse_en: We delivered Moses and every one with him,
verse_ar: وَأَنجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥٓ أَجْمَعِينَ

verse_en: And We drowned the others.
verse_ar: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ

verse_en: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
verse_ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Indeed your Lord is mighty and merciful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: Relate the news of Abraham to them.
verse_ar: وَٱتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ

verse_en: When he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"
verse_ar: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ

verse_en: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًۭا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ

verse_en: (Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them?
verse_ar: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ

verse_en: Or do they benefit you, or do you harm?"
verse_ar: أَوْ يَنفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ

verse_en: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ

verse_en: He said: "Have you considered what you have been worshipping,
verse_ar: قَالَ أَفَرَءَيْتُم مَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ

verse_en: You and your fathers?
verse_ar: أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُمُ ٱلْأَقْدَمُونَ

verse_en: Yet they are my enemies except the Lord of all the worlds
verse_ar: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّۭ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: Who created me and showed me the way,
verse_ar: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَنِى فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ

verse_en: Who gives me food and drink,
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِى هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِى وَيَسْقِينِ

verse_en: And heals me when I am sick,
verse_ar: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ

verse_en: Who will make me die, then give me life again,
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِى يُمِيتُنِى ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ

verse_en: And who, I hope, will condone my faults on the Day of Judgement.
verse_ar: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ

verse_en: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous,
verse_ar: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًۭا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

verse_en: And uphold my name with posterity,
verse_ar: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍۢ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرِينَ

verse_en: And put me among the inheritors of Paradise.
verse_ar: وَٱجْعَلْنِى مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

verse_en: Forgive me and my father: He was surely among those who went astray.
verse_ar: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

verse_en: And do not disgrace me on the day when they are raised from the graves,
verse_ar: وَلَا تُخْزِنِى يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ

verse_en: The day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail
verse_ar: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌۭ وَلَا بَنُونَ

verse_en: But to him who comes to God with a tranquil heart."
verse_ar: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍۢ سَلِيمٍۢ

verse_en: Paradise will be brought near those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path;
verse_ar: وَأُزْلِفَتِ ٱلْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ

verse_en: And Hell made visible to those who had gone astray.
verse_ar: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ

verse_en: They will be asked: "Where are those you worshipped
verse_ar: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ

verse_en: Other than God? Can they save you or even save themselves?"
verse_ar: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ

verse_en: They will then be thrown into Hell with those who had gone astray
verse_ar: فَكُبْكِبُوا۟ فِيهَا هُمْ وَٱلْغَاوُۥنَ

verse_en: Together with the hordes of Iblis.
verse_ar: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ

verse_en: Disputing among themselves they will say:
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ

verse_en: "By God, we were plainly in error
verse_ar: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍ

verse_en: In equating you with the Lord of all the worlds;
verse_ar: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُم بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: No one but the sinners led us astray.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَضَلَّنَآ إِلَّا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ

verse_en: Now we have none to intercede for us,
verse_ar: فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَٰفِعِينَ

verse_en: Nor any sincere friend.
verse_ar: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍۢ

verse_en: If only we could return and be among the believers!"
verse_ar: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةًۭ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Verily there is a sign in this, but many of them do not believe.
verse_ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: The people of Noah accused the apostles of lies.
verse_ar: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ

verse_en: When their brother Noah said to them: "Will you not take heed?
verse_ar: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

verse_en: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
verse_ar: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ

verse_en: So be fearful of God and listen to me.
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: So fear God and follow me."
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: They said: "Should we place our trust in you when only the condemned follow you?"
verse_ar: ۞ قَالُوٓا۟ أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَٱتَّبَعَكَ ٱلْأَرْذَلُونَ

verse_en: He said: "It is not for me to know what they were doing.
verse_ar: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ

verse_en: It is for my Lord to bring them to book, if you can understand.
verse_ar: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ

verse_en: I am certainly not one to drive away the believers.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِطَارِدِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: I am only a plain admonisher."
verse_ar: إِنْ أَنَا۠ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ

verse_en: They said: "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will be stoned to death."
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ

verse_en: He prayed: "O Lord, verily my people accuse me of lies.
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِى كَذَّبُونِ

verse_en: So adjudge between me and them conclusively, and save me and the believers who are with me."
verse_ar: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًۭا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: So We delivered him and those with him in the loaded ark,
verse_ar: فَأَنجَيْنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ

verse_en: And drowned the rest of them.
verse_ar: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ ٱلْبَاقِينَ

verse_en: Verily there is a sign in this, yet many of them do not believe.
verse_ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: But surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: The people of 'Ad accused the messengers of lies.
verse_ar: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ

verse_en: When their brother Hud said to them: "Will you not take heed?
verse_ar: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

verse_en: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
verse_ar: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ

verse_en: So fear God and listen to me.
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: You construct monuments on every hill in vain,
verse_ar: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ ءَايَةًۭ تَعْبَثُونَ

verse_en: Erect palaces (thinking) that you will live for ever,
verse_ar: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ

verse_en: And whenever you apply force become tyrannical.
verse_ar: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُم بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ

verse_en: So be fearful of God and follow me.
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: Fear Him who has bestowed on you what you know,
verse_ar: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَمَدَّكُم بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ

verse_en: Gave you increase of cattle and sons,
verse_ar: أَمَدَّكُم بِأَنْعَٰمٍۢ وَبَنِينَ

verse_en: And orchards and springs.
verse_ar: وَجَنَّٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍ

verse_en: I fear the punishment of a terrible day for you.
verse_ar: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍۢ

verse_en: They said: "It is the same to us if you warn us or do not warn.
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ

verse_en: This is just a habit of antiquated people.
verse_ar: إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا خُلُقُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ

verse_en: We are not going to be damned."
verse_ar: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ

verse_en: Then they accused him of lies; so We annihilated them. Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
verse_ar: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and merciful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: The Thamud accused the messengers of lies.
verse_ar: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ

verse_en: When their brother Saleh said to them: "Will you not take heed?"
verse_ar: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

verse_en: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
verse_ar: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ

verse_en: So fear God and follow me.
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: I do not ask any recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: (Do you think) you will be left secure here
verse_ar: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِى مَا هَٰهُنَآ ءَامِنِينَ

verse_en: In these gardens and these springs,
verse_ar: فِى جَنَّٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍۢ

verse_en: The fields of corn and date-palm trees with soft and tender spathes,
verse_ar: وَزُرُوعٍۢ وَنَخْلٍۢ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌۭ

verse_en: And dwellings hewed out of mountains ingeniously?
verse_ar: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًۭا فَٰرِهِينَ

verse_en: So be mindful of God and listen to me.
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: Do not follow those who are extravagant,
verse_ar: وَلَا تُطِيعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ

verse_en: Who corrupt the land and do not reform it."
verse_ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ

verse_en: They said: "Surely you are deluded.
verse_ar: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَحَّرِينَ

verse_en: You are nothing but a man like us. Bring us a token if you speak the truth."
verse_ar: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

verse_en: (Saleh) said: "Here is a she-camel. She has a right of drinking water, and you have a right of drinking it on appointed turns.
verse_ar: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌۭ لَّهَا شِرْبٌۭ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ

verse_en: Do not treat her unkindly or the punishment of a grievous day will fall on you."
verse_ar: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍۢ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍۢ

verse_en: But they hamstrung her; and on the morrow were repentant,
verse_ar: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ نَٰدِمِينَ

verse_en: For they were seized by the torment. Verily there was a sign in this, but most of them did not believe.
verse_ar: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: The people of Lot accused the messengers of lies.
verse_ar: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ

verse_en: When their brother Lot said to them: "Will you not take heed?
verse_ar: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

verse_en: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
verse_ar: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ

verse_en: So fear God and listen to me.
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: Why do you go for males unlike all other creatures
verse_ar: أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: Leaving the consorts your Lord has made for you? But you are a people who exceed the bounds."
verse_ar: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ

verse_en: They said: "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will be expelled (from the city)."
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ

verse_en: (Lot) said: "I am disgusted with your actions,"
verse_ar: قَالَ إِنِّى لِعَمَلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْقَالِينَ

verse_en: (And prayed:) "O Lord, save me and my family from what they do."
verse_ar: رَبِّ نَجِّنِى وَأَهْلِى مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ

verse_en: So We saved him and his whole family
verse_ar: فَنَجَّيْنَٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ أَجْمَعِينَ

verse_en: Except one old woman who remained behind.
verse_ar: إِلَّا عَجُوزًۭا فِى ٱلْغَٰبِرِينَ

verse_en: Then We destroyed the rest of them,
verse_ar: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا ٱلْءَاخَرِينَ

verse_en: And rained on them a shower (of Stones). How terrible was the rain (that fell) on those who had been warned!
verse_ar: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًۭا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ

verse_en: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe.
verse_ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and powerful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: The people of the Wood too called the messengers liars.
verse_ar: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَٰبُ لْـَٔيْكَةِ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ

verse_en: When Shu'aib said to them: "Will you not take heed?
verse_ar: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

verse_en: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.
verse_ar: إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ

verse_en: So fear God and follow me.
verse_ar: فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ

verse_en: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: Give full measure and do not cheat;
verse_ar: ۞ أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ

verse_en: Weigh on an even balance.
verse_ar: وَزِنُوا۟ بِٱلْقِسْطَاسِ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمِ

verse_en: And do not withhold from people what belongs to them, and do not corrupt the land;
verse_ar: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ

verse_en: And fear Him who created you and all the earlier people."
verse_ar: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ وَٱلْجِبِلَّةَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ

verse_en: They said: "Surely you are deluded.
verse_ar: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَحَّرِينَ

verse_en: You are nothing but a man like us, and we think you are a liar.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَٰذِبِينَ

verse_en: But in case you are speaking the truth, then make a segment of the sky to fall upon us."
verse_ar: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ

verse_en: (Shu'aib) said: "My Lord knows well what you are doing."
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبِّىٓ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ

verse_en: But they denied him, and We seized them with the torment of the Day of Shadowing (when the cloud had rained down fire). It was indeed the torment of a terrible day!
verse_ar: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

verse_en: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe.
verse_ar: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: And this (Qur'an) is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds,
verse_ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: Which the trusted spirit descended with
verse_ar: نَزَلَ بِهِ ٱلرُّوحُ ٱلْأَمِينُ

verse_en: To (communicate) to your heart that you may be a warner
verse_ar: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنذِرِينَ

verse_en: In eloquent Arabic.
verse_ar: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِىٍّۢ مُّبِينٍۢ

verse_en: This is (indicated) in the Books of earlier people.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَفِى زُبُرِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ

verse_en: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of Israel knew about this?
verse_ar: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ

verse_en: Had We revealed it to a man of obscure tongue
verse_ar: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ ٱلْأَعْجَمِينَ

verse_en: And he had recited it to them, and they had not believed (it would have been different).
verse_ar: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Thus do We cause (unbelief) to enter the hearts of sinners.
verse_ar: كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكْنَٰهُ فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ

verse_en: They will not believe it until they behold the painful punishment.
verse_ar: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ

verse_en: It will come upon them unawares, and they will not comprehend it.
verse_ar: فَيَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةًۭ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

verse_en: Then will they say: "Can we be given respite?"
verse_ar: فَيَقُولُوا۟ هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ

verse_en: Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?
verse_ar: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

verse_en: Just think: If We let them enjoy (the good things of life) for a few years more,
verse_ar: أَفَرَءَيْتَ إِن مَّتَّعْنَٰهُمْ سِنِينَ

verse_en: And then what they were promised comes upon them,
verse_ar: ثُمَّ جَآءَهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُوعَدُونَ

verse_en: Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them?
verse_ar: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ

verse_en: Never have We destroyed a habitation till We had sent admonishers to them
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ

verse_en: To warn. For We are never unjust.
verse_ar: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَٰلِمِينَ

verse_en: The devils did not bring it down:
verse_ar: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ

verse_en: They are not worthy of it, nor have they power.
verse_ar: وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ

verse_en: They have been precluded from hearing it.
verse_ar: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ

verse_en: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment;
verse_ar: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ

verse_en: And warn your near relations,
verse_ar: وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ ٱلْأَقْرَبِينَ

verse_en: And take those believers under your wing who follow you.
verse_ar: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: If they do not obey you, tell them: "I am not responsible for what you do."
verse_ar: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌۭ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ

verse_en: Have trust in the Mighty, the Merciful,
verse_ar: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ

verse_en: Who watches you when you get up,
verse_ar: ٱلَّذِى يَرَىٰكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ

verse_en: And your movements among those who bow in homage to God.
verse_ar: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِى ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ

verse_en: He is all-hearing and all-knowing.
verse_ar: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ

verse_en: Should I tell you on whom the devils descend?
verse_ar: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ

verse_en: They come down to every mendacious sinner,
verse_ar: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍۢ

verse_en: Who listens to you (for spreading rumours); but most of them are liars.
verse_ar: يُلْقُونَ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَٰذِبُونَ

verse_en: As for the poets, only those who go astray follow them.
verse_ar: وَٱلشُّعَرَآءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ ٱلْغَاوُۥنَ

verse_en: Have you not seen that they wander distract in every valley,
verse_ar: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍۢ يَهِيمُونَ

verse_en: And they say what they do not do,
verse_ar: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ

verse_en: Except those who believe and do the right, and remember God a great deal, who retaliate only when they have been wronged. Yet the oppressors will now come to know through what reversals they will be overthrown!
verse_ar: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًۭا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍۢ يَنقَلِبُونَ

verse_en: TA SIN. THESE are the verses of the Qur'an, and collection of explicit laws,
verse_ar: طسٓ ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَكِتَابٍۢ مُّبِينٍ

verse_en: A guidance and good tidings for the believers,
verse_ar: هُدًۭى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Who fulfil their devotional obligations, pay the zakat, and believe with certainty in the life to come.
verse_ar: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْءَاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ

verse_en: We make their deeds attractive to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, so that they may wander in perplexity.
verse_ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْءَاخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ

verse_en: They are those who will suffer the worst chastisement in this life, and will be the greatest losers in the life to come.
verse_ar: أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ

verse_en: You have been conveyed the Qur'an from One all-wise and all-knowing.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ

verse_en: (Remember) when Moses said to his family: "I see a fire. I shall bring you news from it, or bring an ember that you may warm yourselves."
verse_ar: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِۦٓ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًۭا سَـَٔاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ ءَاتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍۢ قَبَسٍۢ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ

verse_en: But when he reached it, a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds.
verse_ar: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِىَ أَنۢ بُورِكَ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: O Moses, I am that God, the mighty and all-wise.
verse_ar: يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ

verse_en: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent he turned his back and fled without turning (to look). "O Moses," (said the voice), "be not fearful. Surely those sent as messengers do not fear in My presence,
verse_ar: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّۭ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًۭا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَٰمُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّى لَا يَخَافُ لَدَىَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ

verse_en: Except those who do some wrong but afterwards do good to make up for the wrong. And I am forgiving and merciful.
verse_ar: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًۢا بَعْدَ سُوٓءٍۢ فَإِنِّى غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ

verse_en: Put your hand in the bosom of your shirt; it will come out white without any blemish. This will be one of nine tokens for the Pharaoh and his people, who are a wicked lot indeed."
verse_ar: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍۢ ۖ فِى تِسْعِ ءَايَٰتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۭا فَٰسِقِينَ

verse_en: And when Our signs came as distinct proofs, they said: "This is only magic."
verse_ar: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْهُمْ ءَايَٰتُنَا مُبْصِرَةًۭ قَالُوا۟ هَٰذَا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ

verse_en: And they denied them out of malice and pride, though in their hearts they believed that they were true. So see how was the end of evil-doers!
verse_ar: وَجَحَدُوا۟ بِهَا وَٱسْتَيْقَنَتْهَآ أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًۭا وَعُلُوًّۭا ۚ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ

verse_en: We gave David and Solomon knowledge; and they said: "All praise be to God who has favoured us over many of His creatures who believe."
verse_ar: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيْمَٰنَ عِلْمًۭا ۖ وَقَالَا ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍۢ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Solomon was heir to David, and he said: "O people, we have been taught the language of Tair, and have been given of everything. This is a clear favour indeed."
verse_ar: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَٰنُ دَاوُۥدَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنطِقَ ٱلطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْفَضْلُ ٱلْمُبِينُ

verse_en: His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled, formed into ranks, (and marched)
verse_ar: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَٰنَ جُنُودُهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ وَٱلطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ

verse_en: Till they reached the Valley of Naml. Said the lady of Naml: "O Naml, go into your dwellings lest Solomon and his hordes should crush you unawares."
verse_ar: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ وَادِ ٱلنَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌۭ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّمْلُ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ مَسَٰكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَٰنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

verse_en: (Solomon) smiled, amused at her speech, and said: "O Lord grant me that I should be grateful for the favours You have bestowed on me and my parents, and do good things of Your pleasing; and admit me among Your righteous devotees by Your grace."
verse_ar: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًۭا مِّن قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِىٓ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَىَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَٰلِدَىَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَٰلِحًۭا تَرْضَىٰهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِى بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِى عِبَادِكَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

verse_en: When he reviewed the Tair, he said: "How is it I do not see Hud-hud? Is he absent?
verse_ar: وَتَفَقَّدَ ٱلطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِىَ لَآ أَرَى ٱلْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْغَآئِبِينَ

verse_en: I will punish him severely, or cut his throat, unless he bring a valid excuse."
verse_ar: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُۥ عَذَابًۭا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَا۟ذْبَحَنَّهُۥٓ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّى بِسُلْطَٰنٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ

verse_en: But he was not long in coming, and reported: "I have been around where you have not been. I come from Saba with positive news.
verse_ar: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍۢ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍۭ بِنَبَإٍۢ يَقِينٍ

verse_en: I found a woman reigning over them, and she has been favoured with everything; and she has a throne that is magnificent.
verse_ar: إِنِّى وَجَدتُّ ٱمْرَأَةًۭ تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌۭ

verse_en: I found that she and her people worship the sun in place of God, for Satan has made their deeds look attractive to them and has turned them away from the Path, so they do not find the way
verse_ar: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنُ أَعْمَٰلَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ

verse_en: To worship God who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and is cognisant of what you hide and what you disclose.
verse_ar: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى يُخْرِجُ ٱلْخَبْءَ فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ

verse_en: God: There is no god but He, the Lord of the glorious throne."
verse_ar: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ ۩

verse_en: (Solomon) said: 'We shall see if you speak the truth or you are a liar.
verse_ar: ۞ قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَٰذِبِينَ

verse_en: Take this letter from me, and deliver it to them and withdraw, then see what reply they give in return."
verse_ar: ٱذْهَب بِّكِتَٰبِى هَٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ

verse_en: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me.
verse_ar: قَالَتْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ إِنِّىٓ أُلْقِىَ إِلَىَّ كِتَٰبٌۭ كَرِيمٌ

verse_en: It is from Solomon, and (says): 'In the name of Allah, Ar-Rahman, Ar-Rahim.
verse_ar: إِنَّهُۥ مِن سُلَيْمَٰنَ وَإِنَّهُۥ بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ

verse_en: Do not rise against me, but come to me in submission.'
verse_ar: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا۟ عَلَىَّ وَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ

verse_en: ." Advise me, O nobles," she said "in this matter. I do not decide any thing until you concur."
verse_ar: قَالَتْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَفْتُونِى فِىٓ أَمْرِى مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ

verse_en: They said: "We are men of valour, and brave fighters. It is for you to decide. So consider what you should command."
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ نَحْنُ أُو۟لُوا۟ قُوَّةٍۢ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ بَأْسٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ وَٱلْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَٱنظُرِى مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ

verse_en: She said: "Surely when kings enter a city they destroy it and despoil the honour of its nobility. So will they do (to us).
verse_ar: قَالَتْ إِنَّ ٱلْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا۟ قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوٓا۟ أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَآ أَذِلَّةًۭ ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ

verse_en: But I will send them a gift and see what the envoys bring back (in return)."
verse_ar: وَإِنِّى مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍۢ فَنَاظِرَةٌۢ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ

verse_en: So, when the envoys came to Solomon he said: "Do you wish to increase my wealth? Yet what God has given me is better than what He has given you. No. Be gratified in your present.
verse_ar: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ سُلَيْمَٰنَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍۢ فَمَآ ءَاتَىٰنِۦَ ٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌۭ مِّمَّآ ءَاتَىٰكُم بَلْ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ

verse_en: Go back to them. We shall soon come with our armies which they will not be able to face. We shall drive them out of (the land) with ignominy, and they will be humbled."
verse_ar: ٱرْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍۢ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَآ أَذِلَّةًۭ وَهُمْ صَٰغِرُونَ

verse_en: He (then) said (to his courtiers): "O you nobles, is there any one who can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
verse_ar: قَالَ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِى بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ

verse_en: A crafty jinn said: "I will bring it before you rise from your seat, for I am strong and trustworthy."
verse_ar: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ ۖ وَإِنِّى عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِىٌّ أَمِينٌۭ

verse_en: But one who had knowledge of the letter, said: "I will bring it to you in the twinkling of an eye." When Solomon saw it before him, (he said): "This is by the grace of my Lord that He may test me whether I am grateful or I am thankless. Yet if one is grateful, he is grateful for himself, and if one is thankless, then surely my Lord is unconcerned and magnanimous."
verse_ar: قَالَ ٱلَّذِى عِندَهُۥ عِلْمٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُۥ قَالَ هَٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّى لِيَبْلُوَنِىٓ ءَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّى غَنِىٌّۭ كَرِيمٌۭ

verse_en: (Turning to his nobles) he said: "Change the appearance of her throne. Let us see if she is rightly guided, or is not guided at all."
verse_ar: قَالَ نَكِّرُوا۟ لَهَا عَرْشَهَا نَنظُرْ أَتَهْتَدِىٓ أَمْ تَكُونُ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ

verse_en: When she arrived, they asked her: "Is your throne like this?" She said: "As though this is it. We had come to have knowledge and already submitted."
verse_ar: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ قِيلَ أَهَٰكَذَا عَرْشُكِ ۖ قَالَتْ كَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ ۚ وَأُوتِينَا ٱلْعِلْمَ مِن قَبْلِهَا وَكُنَّا مُسْلِمِينَ

verse_en: She was (in fact) turned away by what she worshipped other than God, for she came of an unbelieving people.
verse_ar: وَصَدَّهَا مَا كَانَت تَّعْبُدُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهَا كَانَتْ مِن قَوْمٍۢ كَٰفِرِينَ

verse_en: She was invited to enter the court. When she saw it, she took it for a sheet of water, and (pulling up her skirts) uncovered her legs. (Solomon) told her: "This is paved with tiles of glass." "O Lord," she said, "I have wronged myself, and I submit to the Lord of all the worlds with Solomon."
verse_ar: قِيلَ لَهَا ٱدْخُلِى ٱلصَّرْحَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَتْهُ حَسِبَتْهُ لُجَّةًۭ وَكَشَفَتْ عَن سَاقَيْهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ صَرْحٌۭ مُّمَرَّدٌۭ مِّن قَوَارِيرَ ۗ قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّى ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِى وَأَسْلَمْتُ مَعَ سُلَيْمَٰنَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh (who said): "Worship God." But they were divided into two groups disputing with one another.
verse_ar: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَٰلِحًا أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ فَإِذَا هُمْ فَرِيقَانِ يَخْتَصِمُونَ

verse_en: (Saleh) said: "O people, why do you wish to hasten evil rather than good? Why not ask for God's forgiveness? You may well be forgiven."
verse_ar: قَالَ يَٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ ۖ لَوْلَا تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ

verse_en: They said: "You betoken evil, and those with you." (Saleh) replied: "The evil you presage can only come from God. In reality you are a people under trial (for your own inauspiciousness)."
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ ٱطَّيَّرْنَا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَّعَكَ ۚ قَالَ طَٰٓئِرُكُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌۭ تُفْتَنُونَ

verse_en: There were in that city nine persons who spread disorder in the land, and did not reform.
verse_ar: وَكَانَ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ تِسْعَةُ رَهْطٍۢ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ

verse_en: They said: "Let us swear by God that we will attack Saleh and his family at night, and later tell his heirs: 'We did not see his family destroyed, and we speak the truth.'"
verse_ar: قَالُوا۟ تَقَاسَمُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُۥ وَأَهْلَهُۥ ثُمَّ لَنَقُولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِۦ مَا شَهِدْنَا مَهْلِكَ أَهْلِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَصَٰدِقُونَ

verse_en: They hatched up the plot; We also planned without their knowledge.
verse_ar: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًۭا وَمَكَرْنَا مَكْرًۭا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

verse_en: Now see the end of their machinations: We destroyed them and their entire people.
verse_ar: فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ مَكْرِهِمْ أَنَّا دَمَّرْنَٰهُمْ وَقَوْمَهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

verse_en: So these their habitations lie deserted now because of their iniquities. Verily there is a sign in this for those who understand.
verse_ar: فَتِلْكَ بُيُوتُهُمْ خَاوِيَةًۢ بِمَا ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةًۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْلَمُونَ

verse_en: We deliver those who believe and take heed for themselves.
verse_ar: وَأَنجَيْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ

verse_en: (Remember) Lot, when he said to his people: "Why do you indulge in obscenities when you know (it is evil)?
verse_ar: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَٰحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ

verse_en: You lust after men in place of women. You are indeed a stolid people."
verse_ar: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةًۭ مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌۭ تَجْهَلُونَ

verse_en: His people had no answer except saying: "Expel the family of Lot from your city. They are a people who would (rather) be pure!"
verse_ar: ۞ فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوٓا۟ أَخْرِجُوٓا۟ ءَالَ لُوطٍۢ مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌۭ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ

verse_en: So We saved him and his family except his wife who was destined to stay behind.
verse_ar: فَأَنجَيْنَٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرْنَٰهَا مِنَ ٱلْغَٰبِرِينَ

verse_en: And We rained down on them a shower (of stones). How ruinous was the rain that fell on those who had been warned (but warned in vain)!
verse_ar: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًۭا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ

verse_en: Say: "All praise be to God, and peace on those of His creatures whom He has chosen." Is God better or those they associate with Him --
verse_ar: قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ عِبَادِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱصْطَفَىٰٓ ۗ ءَآللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ

verse_en: Who created the heavens and the earth, who sends down water from the sky for you, with which He causes graceful gardens to grow? It was not in your power to make trees germinate. Is there any other god along with God. In fact they are a people who turn away (from the truth).
verse_ar: أَمَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ حَدَآئِقَ ذَاتَ بَهْجَةٍۢ مَّا كَانَ لَكُمْ أَن تُنۢبِتُوا۟ شَجَرَهَآ ۗ أَءِلَٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌۭ يَعْدِلُونَ

verse_en: Who then made the earth a habitable place, and made the rivers (flow) in its valleys and dales, and placed upon it firm stabilisers, and kept a barrier between two bodies of water? Is there any other god along with God? In reality most of them do not know.
verse_ar: أَمَّن جَعَلَ ٱلْأَرْضَ قَرَارًۭا وَجَعَلَ خِلَٰلَهَآ أَنْهَٰرًۭا وَجَعَلَ لَهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ حَاجِزًا ۗ أَءِلَٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

verse_en: Who hears the cry of the anguished (soul) when it calls to Him, and relieves its suffering? And who made you trustees on the earth? Is there any other god along with God? How little it is that you reflect!
verse_ar: أَمَّن يُجِيبُ ٱلْمُضْطَرَّ إِذَا دَعَاهُ وَيَكْشِفُ ٱلسُّوٓءَ وَيَجْعَلُكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قَلِيلًۭا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ

verse_en: Who then really shows you the way in the darkness of the desert and the sea? And who sends breezes bringing news of His benevolence? Is there any other god along with God? He is far too exalted for what they associate with Him!
verse_ar: أَمَّن يَهْدِيكُمْ فِى ظُلُمَٰتِ ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ وَمَن يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦٓ ۗ أَءِلَٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ تَعَٰلَى ٱللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ

verse_en: Who creates first then reverts it? And who gives you provision from the heavens and the earth? Is there any other god along with God? Tell them: "Bring your proof, if you are truthful."
verse_ar: أَمَّن يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ وَمَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَٰهٌۭ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَٰنَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ

verse_en: Say: "No one in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unknown except God, nor can they know when they will be raised again.
verse_ar: قُل لَّا يَعْلَمُ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْغَيْبَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ

verse_en: Still less do they comprehend the life to come. In fact they are in doubt about it. Still more, they are blind to it."
verse_ar: بَلِ ٱدَّٰرَكَ عِلْمُهُمْ فِى ٱلْءَاخِرَةِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى شَكٍّۢ مِّنْهَا ۖ بَلْ هُم مِّنْهَا عَمُونَ

verse_en: Those who do not believe, say: "When we and our fathers have turned to dust, how shall we be raised again?
verse_ar: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا كُنَّا تُرَٰبًۭا وَءَابَآؤُنَآ أَئِنَّا لَمُخْرَجُونَ

verse_en: Indeed we and our fathers had been promised this before. It is nothing but the earlier people's lore."
verse_ar: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا هَٰذَا نَحْنُ وَءَابَآؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ

verse_en: Say: "Travel in the land and see how (bad) was the end of sinners."
verse_ar: قُلْ سِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ

verse_en: Do not grieve over them, and do not be distressed by what they contrive.
verse_ar: وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُن فِى ضَيْقٍۢ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ

verse_en: Yet they say: "When will this promise come to pass? (Tell Us) if you speak the truth."
verse_ar: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَٰدِقِينَ

verse_en: Say: "Perhaps some of what you wish to hasten is right behind you."
verse_ar: قُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعْضُ ٱلَّذِى تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ

verse_en: Verily your Lord is gracious to men, though most men are ungrateful.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ

verse_en: Verily your Lord knows what lies hidden in their breasts and what they disclose.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ

verse_en: There is nothing of the hidden in the heavens and the earth that is not recorded in the luminous Book.
verse_ar: وَمَا مِنْ غَآئِبَةٍۢ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا فِى كِتَٰبٍۢ مُّبِينٍ

verse_en: Indeed this Qur'an explains to the children of Israel much of what they are at variance.
verse_ar: إِنَّ هَٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ يَقُصُّ عَلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَكْثَرَ ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ

verse_en: It is a guidance and grace for those who believe.
verse_ar: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَهُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةٌۭ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: Surely your Lord in His wisdom will decide between them. He is all-mighty and all-knowing.
verse_ar: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِى بَيْنَهُم بِحُكْمِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ

verse_en: So you place your trust in God. Certainly you stand on positive truth.
verse_ar: فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَى ٱلْحَقِّ ٱلْمُبِينِ

verse_en: You cannot make the dead to listen, or the deaf to hear the call, when they have turned their backs,
verse_ar: إِنَّكَ لَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَلَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْا۟ مُدْبِرِينَ

verse_en: Nor can you lead the blind when they have gone astray. You can make none hear except those who believe in Our signs and have come to peace and submission.
verse_ar: وَمَآ أَنتَ بِهَٰدِى ٱلْعُمْىِ عَن ضَلَٰلَتِهِمْ ۖ إِن تُسْمِعُ إِلَّا مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا فَهُم مُّسْلِمُونَ

verse_en: When the sentence will have been passed against them, We shall bring forth beastly brutes from the earth who will torment them, for men certainly do not believe Our signs.
verse_ar: ۞ وَإِذَا وَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَخْرَجْنَا لَهُمْ دَآبَّةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ تُكَلِّمُهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلنَّاسَ كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا لَا يُوقِنُونَ

verse_en: The day We shall gather from every community a section of those who denied Our signs, and they will be brought (in separate groups),
verse_ar: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ فَوْجًۭا مِّمَّن يُكَذِّبُ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ

verse_en: So that when they come (before the Lord) He will say: "Did you deny My signs without having understood them? Or what was it that you were doing?"
verse_ar: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءُو قَالَ أَكَذَّبْتُم بِـَٔايَٰتِى وَلَمْ تُحِيطُوا۟ بِهَا عِلْمًا أَمَّاذَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

verse_en: When the sentence will have been passed upon them for their wickedness, they will not be able to say a word.
verse_ar: وَوَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِم بِمَا ظَلَمُوا۟ فَهُمْ لَا يَنطِقُونَ

verse_en: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest, the day to make things clear? Indeed there are signs in this for people who believe.
verse_ar: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِيَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَٱلنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ

verse_en: The day the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will be terrified, save those whom God please, and all will appear before Him in abjectness.
verse_ar: وَيَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَفَزِعَ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَكُلٌّ أَتَوْهُ دَٰخِرِينَ

verse_en: You will see the mountains and think they are firmly planted, but they will pass away like flying clouds: Artistry of God who perfected everything. He is indeed fully aware of what you do.
verse_ar: وَتَرَى ٱلْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةًۭ وَهِىَ تَمُرُّ مَرَّ ٱلسَّحَابِ ۚ صُنْعَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَتْقَنَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَفْعَلُونَ

verse_en: Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done), and be safe that day from terror.
verse_ar: مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُۥ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْهَا وَهُم مِّن فَزَعٍۢ يَوْمَئِذٍ ءَامِنُونَ

verse_en: But whosoever comes with evil will be flung face forward into the Fire. Can you expect reward for any thing but what you do?
verse_ar: وَمَن جَآءَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ فَكُبَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فِى ٱلنَّارِ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ

verse_en: (Say): "I am commanded to worship the Lord of this land He has blessed, to whom all things belong; and I am commanded to be one of those who submit,
verse_ar: إِنَّمَآ أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ رَبَّ هَٰذِهِ ٱلْبَلْدَةِ ٱلَّذِى حَرَّمَهَا وَلَهُۥ كُلُّ شَىْءٍۢ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ

verse_en: And to recite the Qur'an." Whoever comes to guidance does so for himself; as for him who stays astray, tell him: "I am only a warner."
verse_ar: وَأَنْ أَتْلُوَا۟ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَقُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُنذِرِينَ

verse_en: Say: "All praise be to God. He will show you His signs, and you will recognise them. Your Lord is not heedless of what you do."
verse_ar: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ سَيُرِيكُمْ ءَايَٰتِهِۦ فَتَعْرِفُونَهَا ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ

verse_en: TA SIN MIM.
verse_ar: طسٓمٓ

verse_en: These are the verses of the illuminating Book.
verse_ar: تِلْكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ

verse_en: We narrate to you from the history of Moses and Pharaoh in all verity, for those who believe.
verse_ar: نَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكَ مِن نَّبَإِ مُوسَىٰ وَفِرْعَوْنَ بِٱلْحَقِّ لِقَوْمٍۢ يُؤْمِنُونَ

verse_en: The Pharaoh had become high and mighty in the land, and divided the people into different classes, and impoverished one class, slaying its males and sparing its women, for he was indeed a tyrant.
verse_ar: إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ عَلَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلَ أَهْلَهَا شِيَعًۭا يَسْتَضْعِفُ طَآئِفَةًۭ مِّنْهُمْ يُذَبِّحُ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ وَيَسْتَحْىِۦ نِسَآءَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ

verse_en: We wished to favour those who were weak in the land and make them leaders and heirs,
verse_ar: وَنُرِيدُ أَن نَّمُنَّ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَنَجْعَلَهُمْ أَئِمَّةًۭ وَنَجْعَلَهُمُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ

verse_en: And establish them in the country; and to make the Pharaoh, Haman and their hordes beware of what they feared from them.
verse_ar: وَنُمَكِّنَ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَنُرِىَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَٰمَٰنَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَحْذَرُونَ

verse_en: So We conveyed to the mother of Moses: "Suckle him. If you are afraid for him, cast him in the river without any fear or regret, for We shall restore him to you, and make him an apostle."
verse_ar: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَرْضِعِيهِ ۖ فَإِذَا خِفْتِ عَلَيْهِ فَأَلْقِيهِ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ وَلَا تَخَافِى وَلَا تَحْزَنِىٓ ۖ إِنَّا رَآدُّوهُ إِلَيْكِ وَجَاعِلُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ

verse_en: Then he was picked up by the family of Pharaoh (unaware) that he would become their enemy and a cause for regret. Surely the Pharaoh, Haman and their hordes were habitual sinners.
verse_ar: فَٱلْتَقَطَهُۥٓ ءَالُ فِرْعَوْنَ لِيَكُونَ لَهُمْ عَدُوًّۭا وَحَزَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَٰمَٰنَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا كَانُوا۟ خَٰطِـِٔينَ

verse_en: The Pharaoh's wife said: "He will be a comfort to me and to you. Do not kill him. He may well be of some advantage to us, or we may adopt him as a son." They were not aware (of what the future held in store).
verse_ar: وَقَالَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُ فِرْعَوْنَ قُرَّتُ عَيْنٍۢ لِّى وَلَكَ ۖ لَا تَقْتُلُوهُ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَنفَعَنَآ أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُۥ وَلَدًۭا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

verse_en: The mother of Moses was perturbed in the morning. Had We not strengthened her heart to remain a believer she had almost given him away.
verse_ar: وَأَصْبَحَ فُؤَادُ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰ فَٰرِغًا ۖ إِن كَادَتْ لَتُبْدِى بِهِۦ لَوْلَآ أَن رَّبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قَلْبِهَا لِتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

verse_en: She told his sister: "Follow him." So she kept an eye on him from a distance, unbeknown to them.
verse_ar: وَقَالَتْ لِأُخْتِهِۦ قُصِّيهِ ۖ فَبَصُرَتْ بِهِۦ عَن جُنُبٍۢ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ

verse_en: We made (Moses) refuse a wet nurse. So his sister said: "Should I tell you of a household that could bring him up for you and take care of him?"
verse_ar: ۞ وَحَرَّمْنَا عَلَيْهِ ٱلْمَرَاضِعَ مِن قَبْلُ فَقَالَتْ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰٓ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍۢ يَكْفُلُونَهُۥ لَكُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُۥ نَٰصِحُونَ

verse_en: Thus We restored him to his mother that she may be tranquil and not grieve, and know that the promise of God is true, though most men do not know.
verse_ar: فَرَدَدْنَٰهُ إِلَىٰٓ أُمِّهِۦ كَىْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ وَلِتَعْلَمَ أَنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

verse_en: When he had grown up to full maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus do We recompense the doers of good.
verse_ar: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُۥ وَٱسْتَوَىٰٓ ءَاتَيْنَٰهُ حُكْمًۭا وَعِلْمًۭا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ

verse_en: He came to the city when the people were in a care-free mood, and saw two men quarrelling, one belonging to his community, the other to his enemies. The man who belonged to his community appealed for help against the one who belonged to the enemies. Moses struck him a blow with his fist and finished him off. "This is of Satan's doing," he said. "He is certainly an enemy and a corrupter."
verse_ar: وَدَخَلَ ٱلْمَدِينَةَ عَلَىٰ حِينِ غَفْلَةٍۢ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَا فَوَجَدَ فِيهَا رَجُلَيْنِ يَقْتَتِلَانِ هَٰذَا مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ وَهَٰذَا مِنْ عَدُوِّهِۦ ۖ فَٱسْتَغَٰثَهُ ٱلَّذِى مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ عَلَى ٱلَّذِى مِنْ عَدُوِّهِۦ فَوَكَزَهُۥ مُوسَىٰ فَقَضَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ۖ قَالَ هَٰذَا مِنْ عَمَلِ ٱلشَّيْطَٰنِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ عَدُوٌّۭ مُّضِلٌّۭ مُّبِينٌۭ

verse_en: "O Lord," he prayed, "I have done wrong, forgive me." And God forgave him. Verily He is forgiving and kind.
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِى فَٱغْفِرْ لِى فَغَفَرَ لَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ

verse_en: (Moses) said: "O Lord, as You have been gracious to me I will never aid the guilty."
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَآ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَىَّ فَلَنْ أَكُونَ ظَهِيرًۭا لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ

verse_en: In the morning he came to the city, fearful and hesitant. Just then he who had asked him for help the day before called out for help (again). "You are indeed a meddlesome fellow," Moses said to him.
verse_ar: فَأَصْبَحَ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ خَآئِفًۭا يَتَرَقَّبُ فَإِذَا ٱلَّذِى ٱسْتَنصَرَهُۥ بِٱلْأَمْسِ يَسْتَصْرِخُهُۥ ۚ قَالَ لَهُۥ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّكَ لَغَوِىٌّۭ مُّبِينٌۭ

verse_en: Then as he was about to lay hands on the one who was their common enemy, he cried out: "O Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed that person yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and no peacemaker."
verse_ar: فَلَمَّآ أَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَبْطِشَ بِٱلَّذِى هُوَ عَدُوٌّۭ لَّهُمَا قَالَ يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ أَتُرِيدُ أَن تَقْتُلَنِى كَمَا قَتَلْتَ نَفْسًۢا بِٱلْأَمْسِ ۖ إِن تُرِيدُ إِلَّآ أَن تَكُونَ جَبَّارًۭا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا تُرِيدُ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُصْلِحِينَ

verse_en: There came a man running from the other part of the city. "O Moses," he said, "the chiefs are deliberating to kill you. Go away from the city. I wish you well."
verse_ar: وَجَآءَ رَجُلٌۭ مِّنْ أَقْصَا ٱلْمَدِينَةِ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّ ٱلْمَلَأَ يَأْتَمِرُونَ بِكَ لِيَقْتُلُوكَ فَٱخْرُجْ إِنِّى لَكَ مِنَ ٱلنَّٰصِحِينَ

verse_en: So he left the city, fearful and hesitant, (and) prayed: "O Lord, deliver me from these wicked people."
verse_ar: فَخَرَجَ مِنْهَا خَآئِفًۭا يَتَرَقَّبُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ نَجِّنِى مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

verse_en: Then as he turned his face to Midian, he said: "Maybe my Lord will show me the right way."
verse_ar: وَلَمَّا تَوَجَّهَ تِلْقَآءَ مَدْيَنَ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبِّىٓ أَن يَهْدِيَنِى سَوَآءَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ

verse_en: And when he came to the waters of Midian he found a crowd of people watering (their flocks), and saw two maidens holding back (their cattle). He asked: "What is the trouble with you?" They said: "We cannot water our flock till the shepherds have driven away theirs, and our father is a very old man."
verse_ar: وَلَمَّا وَرَدَ مَآءَ مَدْيَنَ وَجَدَ عَلَيْهِ أُمَّةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْقُونَ وَوَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمُ ٱمْرَأَتَيْنِ تَذُودَانِ ۖ قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُمَا ۖ قَالَتَا لَا نَسْقِى حَتَّىٰ يُصْدِرَ ٱلرِّعَآءُ ۖ وَأَبُونَا شَيْخٌۭ كَبِيرٌۭ

verse_en: So he watered (their flock), and moved into the shade and prayed: "My Lord, I have need of whatever good you send me."
verse_ar: فَسَقَىٰ لَهُمَا ثُمَّ تَوَلَّىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلظِّلِّ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى لِمَآ أَنزَلْتَ إِلَىَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍۢ فَقِيرٌۭ

verse_en: Then one of the (maidens) came to him walking bashfully, (and) said: "My father invites you that he may repay you for having watered our flock." So, when (Moses) came to him and told him his story, he said: "Have no fear. You have escaped from the wicked people."
verse_ar: فَجَآءَتْهُ إِحْدَىٰهُمَا تَمْشِى عَلَى ٱسْتِحْيَآءٍۢ قَالَتْ إِنَّ أَبِى يَدْعُوكَ لِيَجْزِيَكَ أَجْرَ مَا سَقَيْتَ لَنَا ۚ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُۥ وَقَصَّ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقَصَصَ قَالَ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ نَجَوْتَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

verse_en: Said one of the maidens: "O father, employ him. Surely the best (man) to employ is one who is strong and honest."
verse_ar: قَالَتْ إِحْدَىٰهُمَا يَٰٓأَبَتِ ٱسْتَـْٔجِرْهُ ۖ إِنَّ خَيْرَ مَنِ ٱسْتَـْٔجَرْتَ ٱلْقَوِىُّ ٱلْأَمِينُ

verse_en: He said: "I would like to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you if you agree to work for me on hire for eight years. And if you stay on for ten, it is up to you. I do not wish to impose any hardship on you. God willing you will find me a man of honour."
verse_ar: قَالَ إِنِّىٓ أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُنكِحَكَ إِحْدَى ٱبْنَتَىَّ هَٰتَيْنِ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَأْجُرَنِى ثَمَٰنِىَ حِجَجٍۢ ۖ فَإِنْ أَتْمَمْتَ عَشْرًۭا فَمِنْ عِندِكَ ۖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَيْكَ ۚ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

verse_en: (Moses) said: "This is (agreed) between you and me. Whichever term I fulfil, no injustice will be done to me. God is witness to our agreement."
verse_ar: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَكَ ۖ أَيَّمَا ٱلْأَجَلَيْنِ قَضَيْتُ فَلَا عُدْوَٰنَ عَلَىَّ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌۭ

verse_en: When Moses had fulfilled the term and was journeying with his family, he noticed a fire on the side of the mountain. "Wait here," he said to his family; "I have seen a fire. I may haply bring some news from there, or an ember that you may warm yourselves."
verse_ar: ۞ فَلَمَّا قَضَىٰ مُوسَى ٱلْأَجَلَ وَسَارَ بِأَهْلِهِۦٓ ءَانَسَ مِن جَانِبِ ٱلطُّورِ نَارًۭا قَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ ٱمْكُثُوٓا۟ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًۭا لَّعَلِّىٓ ءَاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ جَذْوَةٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ

verse_en: When he drew near, a voice called out to him from the tree on the blessed spot on the right side of the valley: "O Moses, I am verily God, the Lord of all the worlds.
verse_ar: فَلَمَّآ أَتَىٰهَا نُودِىَ مِن شَٰطِئِ ٱلْوَادِ ٱلْأَيْمَنِ فِى ٱلْبُقْعَةِ ٱلْمُبَٰرَكَةِ مِنَ ٱلشَّجَرَةِ أَن يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنِّىٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَٰلَمِينَ

verse_en: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent, he turned about and fled without turning. "O Moses, approach," (said the Voice), "and have no fear. You will be safe.
verse_ar: وَأَنْ أَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّۭ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًۭا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَٰمُوسَىٰٓ أَقْبِلْ وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْءَامِنِينَ

verse_en: Put your hand inside your shirt. It will come out white without a tarnish of blame; and do not be perturbed or afraid. These are two proofs from your Lord for the Pharaoh and his nobles. They are certainly a rebellious people."
verse_ar: ٱسْلُكْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍۢ وَٱضْمُمْ إِلَيْكَ جَنَاحَكَ مِنَ ٱلرَّهْبِ ۖ فَذَٰنِكَ بُرْهَٰنَانِ مِن رَّبِّكَ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۭا فَٰسِقِينَ

verse_en: He said: "O Lord, I have killed a man of theirs, and fear they would kill me.
verse_ar: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى قَتَلْتُ مِنْهُمْ نَفْسًۭا فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ

verse_en: So send my brother Aaron with me as helper for he is more fluent than I with words, that he should affirm me, for I fear that they would call me a liar."
verse_ar: وَأَخِى هَٰرُونُ هُوَ أَفْصَحُ مِنِّى لِسَانًۭا فَأَرْسِلْهُ مَعِىَ رِدْءًۭا يُصَدِّقُنِىٓ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
